greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period 6 sequence [0, 2, 2, 0, -2, -2, ...] except a(0) = 1.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2500
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,-1)
formula: a(n) = 2 * b(n) where b() is multiplicative with b(2^e) = (-1)^(e-1) if e>0, b(3^e) = 0^e, b(p^e) = 1 if p == 1 mod 6, b(p^e) = (-1)^e if p == 5 mod 6.
G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2)) where f(u, v) = 2 * u * (v - 1) - (u - 1)^2 * v.
a(-n) = -a(n) unless n = 0. a(n+3) = -a(n) unless n = 0 or n = -3.
3*a(n) = -(n mod 6) + ((n+2) mod 6) + ((n+3) mod 6) - ((n+5) mod 6) + 3*(binomial(2*n,n) mod 2). - _Paolo P. Lava_, Mar 10 2011
program: (MAGMA) m:=30; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Integers(), m); Coefficients(R!((1 + x+x^2)/(1-x+x^2))); // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 04 2018
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Feb 13 2011
